news.headline: Nasdaq leads markets, Costco hits new high. Dow Jones and S&P 500 rise. Palantir stands out.
news.summary: On Tuesday, the Nasdaq outperformed other major indexes. Costco achieved a record high and is currently in a favorable buying position. The Dow Jones and S&P 500 also showed gains, but the Nasdaq stood out. Notably, Palantir demonstrated its strength, and Costco broke out into a promising trend.

news.headline: Market inflation bets surge as 10-year breakeven rate hits 16-month high at 2.45%, affecting Fed's rate cut strategy.
news.summary: The U.S. 10-year breakeven inflation rate has reached its highest level since October 2023, at 2.45%. This indicates that investors anticipate annual inflation to average 2.45% over the next decade. The increase in inflation expectations is linked to trade policy uncertainty under the Trump administration, impacting Federal Reserve rate forecasts and bond market positioning. In response to these developments, bondholders are looking at Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities (TIPS) as a superior hedge, offering a 2.06% real yield plus inflation compensation if inflation exceeds the 2.45% average over the next 10 years.

news.headline: Conservancy for Cuyahoga Valley National Park searching for new President and CEO with help from Potrero Group.
news.summary: In Peninsula, Ohio on February 4, 2025, the Board of Directors of the Conservancy for Cuyahoga Valley National Park (Conservancy) has initiated the recruitment process for the new President and CEO. They have engaged Potrero Group, a renowned national strategy and search firm, to oversee the search for the ideal candidate. This move signifies the organization's strategic focus on leadership succession and dedication to finding a qualified individual to steer the Conservancy's future direction.

news.headline: Columbia Sportswear Company disclosed Q4 and full year 2024 financials, sharing full-year 2025 projections.
news.summary: Portland-based Columbia Sportswear Company announced its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year of 2024. The company reported revenue of $X for the quarter, showing an increase of X% compared to the previous year. For the full year, the company's revenue reached $X, marking a X% growth from the previous year. Columbia Sportswear also provided its financial outlook for the full year of 2025.

news.headline: Mattel, Inc. (NASDAQ: MAT) reports strong financial results for Q4 and full year 2024, achieving objectives ahead of expectations.
news.summary: Mattel, Inc. released its financial results for both the fourth quarter and full year of 2024, with Ynon Kreiz, the Chairman and CEO, highlighting the company’s operational success during the year. In the fourth quarter, they experienced growth in their topline. The focus for 2024 was on enhancing profitability, growing gross margin, and generating substantial free cash flow. Mattel successfully achieved all these objectives, surpassing initial expectations. As they move into 2025, which marks their 80th year, the company aims to continue this positive momentum.

news.headline: Olo (NYSE: OLO) to report Q4 and fiscal year 2024 results on Feb 25, 2025 after US market closes, with a conference call at 5pm Eastern Time.
news.summary: In New York, Olo Inc., a prominent restaurant technology provider traded on the NYSE under the symbol OLO, revealed plans to disclose its financial performance for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2024 post closure of the U.S. financial markets on February 25, 2025. The company will also conduct a conference call on the same day at 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time to delve into the results and future financial outlook. Interested parties can access a live webcast of the conference call.

news.headline: Key Tronic Corp to expand in Arkansas and Vietnam by 2025, Arkansas by June and Vietnam by Sept, 2025.
news.summary: Arkansas is set to complete its expansion by June 2025, while the expansion in Vietnam is expected to be finished by September 2025. The completion deadlines indicate a significant advancement in infrastructure development in these regions, offering growth opportunities and economic benefits. These expansions will play a crucial role in enhancing the overall infrastructure and capacity, with Arkansas's project aiming to be finalized earlier than Vietnam's. This progress underscores the commitment to improving connectivity and accessibility, ultimately boosting the economic landscape of both areas by the designated timelines.

news.headline: InnovAge reported fiscal Q2 2024 results with total revenue of $209M, a 10.6% increase. Net loss was $13.5M compared to $3.8M in Q2 2023.
news.summary: InnovAge Holding Corp. reported its financial results for the fiscal second quarter ended December 31, 2024. Total revenues were $209.0 million, a 10.6% increase from the same period in 2023, with a net loss of $13.5 million compared to a loss of $3.8 million in 2023. The Center-level Contribution Margin was $37.1 million, up 10.3% from 2023. Adjusted EBITDA was $5.9 million, a decrease of $1.0 million from the previous year. The company had a census of approximately 7,480 participants and ended the quarter with $46.1 million in cash, $40.8 million in short-term investments, and $78.3 million in debt. The company provided financial guidance for the full fiscal year 2025 with a projected revenue range of $815-865 million and Adjusted EBITDA range of $24-31 million. The company will host a conference call to discuss the results further.Overall, InnovAge showed growth in revenue and participant census but experienced an increase in net loss compared to the previous year.

news.headline: Kulicke & Soffa's Q1 2025 results: Net revenue $166.1M, Net income $81.6M, Non-GAAP net income $20.2M. Focus on advanced packaging solutions.
news.summary: Kulicke and Soffa Industries, Inc. reported first quarter financial results for fiscal year 2025, ending December 28, 2024. The company had a net revenue of $166.1 million, with net income of $81.6 million and EPS of $1.51 per fully diluted share. Non-GAAP net income was $20.2 million, with non-GAAP EPS of $0.37 per fully diluted share. There was a significant increase in income from operations and net income compared to the same quarter in the previous year. The company also provided an outlook for the second quarter of fiscal year 2025, with an expected net revenue of approximately $165 million. Kulicke & Soffa focuses on semiconductor and electronics assembly solutions to support various industries and technological advancements.

news.headline: Jack Henry & Associates' Q2 FY2025 saw GAAP revenue up 5.2%, non-GAAP adjusted rev up 6.1%, and GAAP EPS at $1.34. YTD, GAAP revenue increased 5.2% and GAAP operating income by 9.0%, with GAAP EPS at $2.97. Q2's operating expenses rose 5.7%, reaching $450.8M. Net income grew 6.4% with diluted EPS of $1.34. Non-GAAP adjusted revenue reached $573.8M in Q2. CEO mentions 6% non-GAAP revenue growth. Full-year FY2025 guidance indicates GAAP revenue ranging from $2.369B to $2.391B.
news.summary: In the second quarter of fiscal year 2024, financial technology provider Jack Henry & Associates, Inc. reported a 5.2% increase in GAAP revenue and a 3.4% rise in GAAP operating income compared to the same quarter in the previous fiscal year. Non-GAAP adjusted revenue and operating income also saw increases of 6.1% and 7.3% respectively. GAAP EPS was $1.34 per diluted share for the quarter.For the fiscal year-to-date period ending December 31, 2024, GAAP revenue increased by 5.2% and GAAP operating income by 9.0% compared to the prior year. Non-GAAP adjusted revenue and operating income also saw increases of 5.7% and 4.2% respectively. GAAP EPS for the year-to-date period was $2.97 per diluted share.Cash and cash equivalents were $26 million at December 31, 2024, with debt outstanding related to credit facilities at $150 million. The company expects full-year fiscal 2025 revenue to range from $2,369 million to $2,391 million, with an operating margin projection of 23.0% to 23.2% and an EPS guidance of $5.78 to $5.87.Jack Henry & Associates' CEO praised the company's performance in the second quarter, highlighting record sales attainment and a strong sales pipeline. The company's revenue growth was driven by increases in data processing, hosting, card revenue, and payment processing. Operating income, operating expenses, and net income showed positive growth trends as well. Non-GAAP adjustments led to even higher growth rates in various financial metrics.

The clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company, trading under Nasdaq symbol NVCT, is dedicated to developing precision medicines for unmet medical needs in oncology. The offering involves all shares to be sold by Nuvectis, with a potential for underwriters to acquire an extra 15% within a 30-day option. The completion and specifics of the offering are contingent on market conditions, with no certainty on timing or final size/terms.

news.headline: Carbon Revolution received an extension from Nasdaq, allowing until May 14, 2025 to file its Annual Report on Form 20-F.
news.summary: Carbon Revolution plc, a top global manufacturer of lightweight automotive carbon fiber wheels listed on Nasdaq as CREV, recently announced an extension for filing its Annual Report on Form 20-F. The company received approval from Nasdaq to delay the filing until May 14, 2025. This extension allows Carbon Revolution plc until the specified date to submit the annual report for the fiscal year ending on June 30, 2024. Nasdaq's Listing Rule 5250(c)(1) exception ensures that the company's securities will continue to be listed and traded on the exchange during this period. However, Carbon Revolution plc must ensure compliance with Nasdaq's listing regulations for its securities to remain listed post the extended deadline.

news.headline: Ambassador David Pressman rejoins Jenner & Block, an expert in national security with years of experience in international disputes.
news.summary: On February 4, 2025, Ambassador David Pressman, a renowned national security litigator, diplomat, and strategist, has rejoined Jenner & Block, a prestigious law firm. With extensive experience in handling complex international disputes, Ambassador Pressman brings with him decades of expertise representing clients in high-stakes crises. This move is highly significant given Ambassador Pressman's notable background and his contributions to the legal field, making this a strategic decision for Jenner & Block.

news.headline: Collective Mining drills 51.95m at 8.38 g/t AuEq in New Ramp Zone, deepest hole at Apollo system, bottoming at 1,200m.
news.summary: The recently drilled Hole APC103-D2 at the New Ramp Zone discovery revealed notable results, with an impressive 51.95-meter section grading at 8.38 grams per ton of gold equivalent. This drill hole has set a record as the deepest one ever conducted within the Apollo system, reaching a depth of around 1,200 meters beneath the surface. This discovery underscores significant mineralization potential in the area.
